episodes.title: Frank Parlato Sent NXIVM into Chaos After Sex Cult Branding Story - HBO's The Vow Episode 4
episodes.description:
"I decided to tell Frank about the branding. It was pretty terrifying. But my name wasn't attached so I felt safe." -Sara Edmondson

"When Frank came out with the news [of the branding] it set the whole organization into a panic. A lot of people began asking questions and that was the idea. It's not just to expose what's going on, it was also about getting people to leave. Getting people away from danger." -Mark Vicente

Investigative Reporter Frank Parlato featured on @HBO Documentary The Vow, Episode 4. 

NXIVM was a self-help organization founded by Keith Raniere in 1998. Initially marketed as a personal development program, NXIVM gained attention for its controversial practices and allegations of being a cult. Keith Raniere, also known as "Vanguard" within NXIVM, was the leader and founder of the organization. He presented himself as a charismatic and influential figure, attracting followers who believed in his teachings and philosophies.

Raniere was accused of engaging in manipulative and abusive behavior towards women within NXIVM. It was alleged that he ran a secret society within the organization called DOS (Dominus Obsequious Sororium), which operated as a pyramid scheme and involved coercing women into becoming his "slaves." These women were allegedly subjected to physical and emotional abuse, forced to provide collateral, and were branded with Raniere's initials.

In June 2019, Keith Raniere was convicted on multiple charges, including racketeering, sex trafficking, forced labor conspiracy, and conspiracy to commit identity theft. The trial revealed the extent of his abusive practices and the harm inflicted upon his victims. Raniere was sentenced to 120 years in prison in October 2020.

Frank Parlato is a journalist and whistleblower who played a significant role in exposing the NXIVM sex cult through his investigative reporting. His work shed light on the illegal activities and manipulation within the organization, leading to the arrest and conviction of several high-ranking members, including the cult's leader, Keith Raniere, and former actress Allison Mack. Parlato's reporting helped bring justice to the victims and dismantle the NXIVM sex cult, ultimately exposing the truth behind its operations.

episodes.title: Frank Parlato, the Man Credited for Bringing Down NXIVM, Interviews Imprisoned Keith Raniere
episodes.description:
Investigative Reporter Frank Parlato conducts the first interview with NXIVM sex cult leader Keith Raniere since he was arrested. During the interview, Raniere declares his innocence. Video courtesy of @NBCNews.

episodes.title: When Law Enforcement Wouldn't Listen, Reporter Frank Parlato Did - Branded and Brainwashed Part 2
episodes.description:
On June 5th, 2017, Investigative Reporter Frank Parlato published an article titled "Branded Slaves and Master Raniere; Sources: Human Branding Part of Raniere-inspired Women's Group." Former NXIVM member Kelly Thiel and Catherine Oxenburg, whose daughter India was part the same women's group, discuss Parlato on @Tubi's documentary Branded and Brainwashed.
